video.name: MARBLED CHOCOLATE BANANA BREAD | Vegan Banana Bread |  Vegan Richa Recipes
video.description:
MARBLED CHOCOLATE BANANA BREAD

Get the WRITTEN RECIPE here - https://www.veganricha.com/marbled-vegan-chocolate-banana-bread/

SUBSCRIBE HERE: https://www.youtube.com/veganricharecipes?sub_confirmation=1

Tuck into this Vegan Marbled Chocolate Banana Bread made with a simple dairy-free and eggless batter swirled together into a beautiful marbled pattern. Topped with plenty of vegan chocolate chips this loaf makes for a decadent sweet breakfast treat! Oil-free option included.

If you like Banana Bread in general and the chocolatey kind in particular, then I have a treat for you today! Marbled Vegan Chocolate Banana Bread, ladies and gents! Doesn’t marbling just make everything look better? And honestly, the looks DO matter, especially when we’re talking sweet and decadent vegan treats! This gorgeous Chocolate Banana Loaf combines the goodness of dark chocolate and ripe bananas to form a loaf of sliceable banana bliss.

******MORE BREAKFAST BAKES FROM THE BLOG******

BANANA WALNUT BREAKFAST LOAF: https://www.veganricha.com/banana-walnut-breakfast-loaf-gluten/

1 BOWL VEGAN PUMPKIN BREAD: https://www.veganricha.com/1-bowl-vegan-pumpkin-bread-recipe/

MARBLED TURMERIC PUMPKIN CHOCOLATE BREAD: https://www.veganricha.com/marbled-turmeric-pumpkin-chocolate-bread/

COOKBOOKS BY RICHA HINGLE (VEGAN RICHA): https://www.veganricha.com/mybooks/

Music: Epidemic Sound 

#veganricha #easyveganreecipes #veganbananabread #veganbread #veganbreakfast #oilfreeoption

recipeIngredient: 1 scant cup mashed banana (Use scant cup, 2 large or 3 medium (if your bread tends to bake gummy use 3/4 cup))
1/3 cup sugar (such as light brown sugar or coconut sugar)
1 tsp vanilla extract  (or 1/2 tsp cinnamon or both)
2 tbsp oil (omit to make oil-free, add a tbsp of shredded coconut for additional moisture)
1/3 cup almond milk (or use other non dairy milk such as light coconut or soy )
1  3/4 cups all-purpose flour (I usually use 1 1/2 all-purpose and 1/4 cup of whole wheat or spelt or all 1 3/4 cup all purpose)
1/4 cup almond flour (, or use more flour for Nutfree )

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 365F (185 C) and line 9x5 inch pan with parchment.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 365F (185 C) and line 9x5 inch pan with parchment.

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl mix all the wet ingredients until well combined
recipeInstructions.name: In a bowl mix all the wet ingredients until well combined

recipeInstructions.text: In another bowl mix the flours, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: In another bowl mix the flours, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Add 1 3/4 cup of the dry mixture to the wet ingredient bowl and mix it in. Add the rest of the dry flour mix 1 tbsp at a time, until batter is stiff like a muffin batter.
recipeInstructions.name: Add 1 3/4 cup of the dry mixture to the wet ingredient bowl and mix it in. Add the rest of the dry flour mix 1 tbsp at a time, until batter is stiff like a muffin batter.

recipeInstructions.text: Divide the batter into two bowls.
recipeInstructions.name: Divide the batter into two bowls.

recipeInstructions.text: For the chocolate layer, mix the cocoa in a small bowl with 3 tbsp of boiling water, mix this into the first bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: For the chocolate layer, mix the cocoa in a small bowl with 3 tbsp of boiling water, mix this into the first bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: In the second bowl, add 1-2 tbsp of boiling water and mix in so that mixture is not that thick.
recipeInstructions.name: In the second bowl, add 1-2 tbsp of boiling water and mix in so that mixture is not that thick.

recipeInstructions.text: Now you can assemble the loaf as you like with whatever pattern. I usually alternate the batters and spread them out for a marble effect. Once all of the batter is finished, top with the mini chocolate chips.
recipeInstructions.name: Now you can assemble the loaf as you like with whatever pattern. I usually alternate the batters and spread them out for a marble effect. Once all of the batter is finished, top with the mini chocolate chips.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for 55-60 minutes. Check with a toothpick from the center of the loaf
recipeInstructions.name: Bake for 55-60 minutes. Check with a toothpick from the center of the loaf

recipeInstructions.text: Cool the loaf for 10 minutes before taking it out of the pan, cool completely before slicing.
recipeInstructions.name: Cool the loaf for 10 minutes before taking it out of the pan, cool completely before slicing.
